DOCNAME: CASE OF GIULIA MANZONI v. ITALY
TEXT: CARDINAL . ORG On DATE at QUANTITY was arrested in GPE for insulting , threatening and assaulting CARDINAL municipal police officers in the execution of their duty and taken into police custody .
CARDINAL . ORG The GPE public prosecutor ’s office , which was immediately informed by telephone , confirmed the police custody and the applicant was taken to Rebibbia Prison .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the police forwarded the report on the arrest to the public prosecutor ’s office , which that DATE arranged a hearing for the following morning in ORG , seeking to have the arrest confirmed ( convalida dell’arresto ) .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE at TIME the public prosecutor ’s office also applied for PERSON to be detained at her home pending trial ( LAW of LAW ) .

CARDINAL . ORG After satisfying itself that the relevant statutory formalities in respect of arrest had been complied with ( including bringing the applicant before the public prosecutor ’s office within TIME of her arrest , drawing up and sending on the police report within the same period and requesting the public prosecutor ’s office to confirm the arrest within TIME ) , the court confirmed the arrest . However , it did not consider it necessary to detain PERSON pending trial and ordered that she be released immediately .

CARDINAL . ORG At the end of proceedings known as " patteggiamento " ( a shortened form of procedure whereby , at the request of the public prosecutor ’s office or , as in the present case , of the defendant , the court imposes a sentence agreed on by the public prosecutor ’s office and the defendant ) the court sentenced the applicant to DATE and CARDINAL days’ imprisonment , suspended .

CARDINAL . ORG The hearing ended at TIME At TIME the police escorted PERSON to PERSON . At TIME the record of the hearing was served on her by the prison management . TIME the prison authorities completed the statutory formalities ( accounts , return of effects , notification of release to the police , entry in the prison register ) . At TIME the applicant gave the prison management her address for notification purposes , and at TIME she left the prison .
CARDINAL . ORG LAW has several provisions that are applicable in the instant case , as set out below :
" CARDINAL . Police officers who have effected an arrest ... shall immediately inform the public prosecutor ’s office of this ...

CARDINAL . ... the police officers shall place the person arrested ... at the disposal of the public prosecutor ’s office within TIME of the arrest ... They shall send the police report to the public prosecutor ’s office within TIME unless the latter grants an extension of time . "

" CARDINAL . Within TIME of the arrest ... , if the public prosecutor ’s office does not consider it necessary to release the defendant immediately , it shall ask the judge responsible for the preliminary inquiry to confirm the arrest ...
CARDINAL . The judge shall hold the hearing to confirm the arrest as soon as possible , and in any event not more than TIME after the request for confirmation ... "

" If the arrest is lawful and the time - limits laid down in Articles CARDINAL para . CARDINAL and CARDINAL para . CARDINAL have been observed , the judge shall confirm the arrest in an order . An appeal on points of law shall lie against that decision ... "

" ... the public prosecutor ’s office shall order in a reasoned decision the immediate release of the person arrested ... where it does not envisage applying [ to the judge ] for a preventive measure . "
